About me

What makes me be me.

I like to think of myself as a creator of things.

I'm not keen on job titles, but, for easy reference, you can put me in the web developer bucket. Make that a web developer with a burning passion for open web technologies.

What I do

I play a lot with JavaScript, HTML and CSS to build effective solutions to real problems. While I prefer client-side web development, I will not shy away from trying out server-side black magic.

Follow me on Twitter @razvancaliman if you want to see what grabs my attention from time to time.

Adobe

I work with a bunch of awesome people at Adobe, on the Web Platform team, teaching CSS new tricks. We're building CSS Regions, CSS Shapes and Exclusions, CSS Shaders and more. Keep an eye on us over at html.adobe.com

I put myself through some pain so you don't have to. I work with not-quite-done-yet technology to uncover bugs and quirks. I build JavaScript prototypes to quickly validate ideas and I provide feedback and use cases for web standards proposals. All this to make it easy for you to create awesome stuff with the technology we're building.

Curious by nature

I break a lot of things to understand what makes them tick. That's how I learn best.

I have an attitude towards reducing needless complexity. I believe elegant simple solutions work best in solving real problems.
